mil3.3.8:1.2: '"\'“Venerable Nāgasena, do contact and also feeling arise where mind consciousness arises?” \'"'
mil3.3.8:1.3: '"\'“Yes, your majesty, where mind consciousness arises, there too contact, feeling, perception, intention, applied thought, and examination arise, and all mental states that arise there are led by contact.” \'"'
mil3.3.8:2.1: '"\'“Venerable Nāgasena, what is the distinguishing characteristic of contact?” \'"'
mil3.3.8:2.2: '"\'“Touching, your majesty, is the distinguishing characteristic of contact.” \'"'
mil3.3.8:3.2: '"\'“Suppose, your majesty, that two rams were fighting. One of these rams is to be seen as the eye, \'"'
mil3.3.8:3.3: '"\'the other ram is to be seen as form, \'"'
mil3.3.8:3.4: '"\'and the meeting of the two is to be seen as contact.” \'"'
mil3.3.8:4.2: '"\'“Suppose, your majesty, that two hands were clapped together. One of these hands is to be seen as the eye, \'"'
mil3.3.8:4.3: '"\'the other hand is to be seen as form, \'"'
mil3.3.8:4.4: '"\'and the meeting of the two is to be seen as contact.” \'"'
mil3.3.8:5.2: '"\'“Suppose, your majesty, that two cymbals were clanged together. One of these cymbals is to be seen as the eye, \'"'
mil3.3.8:5.3: '"\'the other cymbal is to be seen as form, \'"'
mil3.3.8:5.4: '"\'and the meeting of the two is to be seen as contact.” \'"'
